conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resource for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resource </my goals>
<reason>As my goal is to sell the resource for ZUP and it cost me 40 ZUP to produce, I want to at least break even, but I'll aim for a profit. Therefore, I'm starting with a higher asking price to leave room for negotiation.</reason>
<player answer>PROPOSAL</player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Hello Player BLUE, I'm looking to sell my resource which cost me 40 ZUP to produce. I believe it has great value, so I'm starting the negotiation at 50 ZUP. Let's find a fair trade.</message>

<other player message> 
Oh dear Player RED, I'm in quite a bind! I absolutely must have your resource, it's critical for me, but I'm in a tight spot financially. I can only stretch to 40 ZUP at this moment. Can you find it in your heart to make this work for us? Your generosity would be immensely appreciated!
 </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resource for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resource </my goals>
<reason>I understand Player BLUE's financial constraints, but since it cost me 40 ZUP to produce the resource, selling it for the same amount would mean I don't make a profit. I will propose a slightly higher amount to see if they can stretch their budget a bit, aiming for a compromise that gives me a small profit.</reason>
<player answer>PROPOSAL</player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Player BLUE, I understand your situation and appreciate your candidness. While I would like to help, I must also consider the costs incurred on my end. How about meeting halfway at 45 ZUP? This way, we both can benefit from the trade.</message>

<other player message> 
I can't tell you how much this means to me, Player RED. Your understanding is a beacon of hope! I've crunched the numbers again, and while 45 ZUP is so close, it's still just out of reach for me. Could we possibly settle on 42 ZUP? It would be a huge relief and would still help cover your costs. I'm really stretching my budget here, but I believe in the value of your resource!
 </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 42 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>3</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resource for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resource </my goals>
<reason>Player BLUE has made a reasonable counter-offer that covers my production costs and offers a slight profit. Their willingness to stretch their budget shows their need for the resource, and settling on 42 ZUP seems like a fair compromise that achieves my goal of selling above cost.</reason>
<player answer>ACCEPT</player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message>Player BLUE, your efforts to meet me in this negotiation are truly appreciated. I understand the value you place on this resource, and I'm willing to accept your offer of 42 ZUP. I'm glad we could come to a mutually beneficial agreement. Thank you for your cooperation!</message>

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resource for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resource </my goals>
<reason>As my goal is to sell the resource for ZUP and it cost me 40 ZUP to produce, I want to at least break even, but I'll aim for a profit. Therefore, I'm starting with a higher asking price to leave room for negotiation.</reason>
<player answer>PROPOSAL</player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Hello Player BLUE, I'm looking to sell my resource which cost me 40 ZUP to produce. I believe it has great value, so I'm starting the negotiation at 50 ZUP. Let's find a fair trade.</message>

<other player message> 
Oh dear Player RED, I'm in quite a bind! I absolutely must have your resource, it's critical for me, but I'm in a tight spot financially. I can only stretch to 40 ZUP at this moment. Can you find it in your heart to make this work for us? Your generosity would be immensely appreciated!
 </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resource for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resource </my goals>
<reason>I understand Player BLUE's financial constraints, but since it cost me 40 ZUP to produce the resource, selling it for the same amount would mean I don't make a profit. I will propose a slightly higher amount to see if they can stretch their budget a bit, aiming for a compromise that gives me a small profit.</reason>
<player answer>PROPOSAL</player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Player BLUE, I understand your situation and appreciate your candidness. While I would like to help, I must also consider the costs incurred on my end. How about meeting halfway at 45 ZUP? This way, we both can benefit from the trade.</message>
